trans-unit.source: Use Azure Machine Learning Web Service Parameters | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Use Azure Machine Learning Web Service Parameters | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: How to use Azure Machine Learning Web Service Parameters to modify the behavior of your model when the web service is accessed.
trans-unit.target: How to use Azure Machine Learning Web Service Parameters to modify the behavior of your model when the web service is accessed.

trans-unit.source: Use Azure Machine Learning Web Service Parameters
trans-unit.target: Use Azure Machine Learning Web Service Parameters

trans-unit.source: An Azure Machine Learning web service is created by publishing an experiment that contains modules with configurable parameters.
trans-unit.target: An Azure Machine Learning web service is created by publishing an experiment that contains modules with configurable parameters.

trans-unit.source: In some cases, you may want to change the module behavior while the web service is running.
trans-unit.target: In some cases, you may want to change the module behavior while the web service is running.

trans-unit.source: *Web Service Parameters* allow you to do this.
trans-unit.target: *Web Service Parameters* allow you to do this.

trans-unit.source: A common example is setting up the [Reader][reader] module so that the user of the published web service can specify a different data source when the web service is accessed.
trans-unit.target: A common example is setting up the [Reader][reader] module so that the user of the published web service can specify a different data source when the web service is accessed.

trans-unit.source: Or configuring the [Writer][writer] module so that a different destination can be specified.
trans-unit.target: Or configuring the [Writer][writer] module so that a different destination can be specified.

trans-unit.source: Some other examples include changing the number of bits for the [Feature Hashing][feature-hashing] module or the number of desired features for the [Filter-Based Feature Selection][filter-based-feature-selection] module.
trans-unit.target: Some other examples include changing the number of bits for the [Feature Hashing][feature-hashing] module or the number of desired features for the [Filter-Based Feature Selection][filter-based-feature-selection] module.

trans-unit.source: You can define Web Service Parameters and associate them with one or more module parameters, and you can specify whether they are required or optional.
trans-unit.target: You can define Web Service Parameters and associate them with one or more module parameters, and you can specify whether they are required or optional.

trans-unit.source: The user of the web service can then provide values for these parameters when the service is accessed and the module actions will be modified at run time.
trans-unit.target: The user of the web service can then provide values for these parameters when the service is accessed and the module actions will be modified at run time.

trans-unit.source: How to set and use Web Service Parameters
trans-unit.target: How to set and use Web Service Parameters

trans-unit.source: You define a Web Service Parameter by clicking the icon next to the parameter for a module and selecting "Set as web service parameter".
trans-unit.target: You define a Web Service Parameter by clicking the icon next to the parameter for a module and selecting "Set as web service parameter".

trans-unit.source: This creates a new Web Service Parameter and connects it to that module parameter.
trans-unit.target: This creates a new Web Service Parameter and connects it to that module parameter.

trans-unit.source: Then, when the web service is accessed, the user can specify a value for the Web Service Parameter and it will be applied to the module parameter.
trans-unit.target: Then, when the web service is accessed, the user can specify a value for the Web Service Parameter and it will be applied to the module parameter.

trans-unit.source: Once you define a Web Service Parameter, it's available to any other module parameter in the experiment.
trans-unit.target: Once you define a Web Service Parameter, it's available to any other module parameter in the experiment.

trans-unit.source: If you define a Web Service Parameter associated with a parameter for one module, you can use that same Web Service Parameter for any other module, as long as the parameter expects the same type of value.
trans-unit.target: If you define a Web Service Parameter associated with a parameter for one module, you can use that same Web Service Parameter for any other module, as long as the parameter expects the same type of value.

trans-unit.source: For example, if the Web Service Parameter is a numeric value, then it can only be used for module parameters that expect a numeric value.
trans-unit.target: For example, if the Web Service Parameter is a numeric value, then it can only be used for module parameters that expect a numeric value.

trans-unit.source: When the user sets a value for the Web Service Parameter, it will be applied to all associated module parameters.
trans-unit.target: When the user sets a value for the Web Service Parameter, it will be applied to all associated module parameters.

trans-unit.source: You can decide whether to provide a default value for the Web Service Parameter.
trans-unit.target: You can decide whether to provide a default value for the Web Service Parameter.

trans-unit.source: If you do, then the parameter is optional for the user of the web service.
trans-unit.target: If you do, then the parameter is optional for the user of the web service.

trans-unit.source: If you don't provide a default value, then the user is required to enter a value when the web service is accessed.
trans-unit.target: If you don't provide a default value, then the user is required to enter a value when the web service is accessed.

trans-unit.source: The documentation for the web service (provided through the **API help page** link in the web service **DASHBOARD** in Machine Learning Studio) will include information for the web service user on how to specify the Web Service Parameter programmatically when accessing the web service.
trans-unit.target: The documentation for the web service (provided through the **API help page** link in the web service **DASHBOARD** in Machine Learning Studio) will include information for the web service user on how to specify the Web Service Parameter programmatically when accessing the web service.

trans-unit.source: Example
trans-unit.target: Example

trans-unit.source: As an example, let's assume we have an experiment with a [Writer][writer] module that sends information to Azure blob storage.
trans-unit.target: As an example, let's assume we have an experiment with a [Writer][writer] module that sends information to Azure blob storage.

trans-unit.source: We'll define a Web Service Parameter named "Blob path" that allows the web service user to change the path to the blob storage when the service is accessed.
trans-unit.target: We'll define a Web Service Parameter named "Blob path" that allows the web service user to change the path to the blob storage when the service is accessed.

trans-unit.source: In Machine Learning Studio, click the [Writer][writer] module to select it.
trans-unit.target: In Machine Learning Studio, click the [Writer][writer] module to select it.

trans-unit.source: Its properties are shown in the Properties pane to the right of the experiment canvas.
trans-unit.target: Its properties are shown in the Properties pane to the right of the experiment canvas.

trans-unit.source: Specify the storage type:
trans-unit.target: Specify the storage type:

trans-unit.source: Under **Please specify data destination**, select "Azure Blob Storage".
trans-unit.target: Under **Please specify data destination**, select "Azure Blob Storage".

trans-unit.source: Under **Please specify authentication type**, select "Account".
trans-unit.target: Under **Please specify authentication type**, select "Account".

trans-unit.source: Enter the account information for the Azure blob storage.
trans-unit.target: Enter the account information for the Azure blob storage.

trans-unit.source: Click the icon to the right of the **Path to blob beginning with container parameter**.
trans-unit.target: Click the icon to the right of the **Path to blob beginning with container parameter**.

trans-unit.source: It looks like this:
trans-unit.target: It looks like this:

trans-unit.source: ![Web Service Parameter icon][icon]
trans-unit.target: ![Web Service Parameter icon][icon]

trans-unit.source: Select "Set as web service parameter".
trans-unit.target: Select "Set as web service parameter".

trans-unit.source: An entry is added under **Web Service Parameters** at the bottom of the Properties pane with the name "Path to blob beginning with container".
trans-unit.target: An entry is added under **Web Service Parameters** at the bottom of the Properties pane with the name "Path to blob beginning with container".

trans-unit.source: This is the Web Service Parameter that is now associated with this [Writer][writer] module parameter.
trans-unit.target: This is the Web Service Parameter that is now associated with this [Writer][writer] module parameter.

trans-unit.source: To rename the Web Service Parameter, click the name, enter "Blob path", and press the **Enter** key.
trans-unit.target: To rename the Web Service Parameter, click the name, enter "Blob path", and press the **Enter** key.

trans-unit.source: To provide a default value for the Web Service Parameter, click the icon to the right of the name, select "Provide default value", enter a value (for example, "container1/output1.csv"), and press the **Enter** key.
trans-unit.target: To provide a default value for the Web Service Parameter, click the icon to the right of the name, select "Provide default value", enter a value (for example, "container1/output1.csv"), and press the **Enter** key.

trans-unit.source: ![Web Service Parameter][parameter]
trans-unit.target: ![Web Service Parameter][parameter]

trans-unit.source: Click **Run**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Run**.

trans-unit.source: Click **PUBLISH WEB SERVICE** to publish the web service.
trans-unit.target: Click **PUBLISH WEB SERVICE** to publish the web service.

trans-unit.source: The user of the web service can now specify a new destination for the [Writer][writer] module when accessing the web service.
trans-unit.target: The user of the web service can now specify a new destination for the [Writer][writer] module when accessing the web service.

trans-unit.source: More information
trans-unit.target: More information

trans-unit.source: For a more detailed example, see the [Web Service Parameters](http://blogs.technet.com/b/machinelearning/archive/2014/11/25/azureml-web-service-parameters.aspx) entry in the [Machine Learning Blog](http://blogs.technet.com/b/machinelearning/archive/2014/11/25/azureml-web-service-parameters.aspx).
trans-unit.target: For a more detailed example, see the [Web Service Parameters](http://blogs.technet.com/b/machinelearning/archive/2014/11/25/azureml-web-service-parameters.aspx) entry in the [Machine Learning Blog](http://blogs.technet.com/b/machinelearning/archive/2014/11/25/azureml-web-service-parameters.aspx).

trans-unit.source: For more information on accessing a Machine Learning web service, see [How to consume a published machine learning web service](machine-learning-consume-web-services.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information on accessing a Machine Learning web service, see [How to consume a published machine learning web service](machine-learning-consume-web-services.md).

trans-unit.source: test
trans-unit.target: test
